NoteLiteral.En:
Entry requirements: 
•	Student at any of the universities of the ECIU;
•	B2 level of English language proficiency.
Applicants need to attach a copy of ID card / passport (document issued by the country of origin) to enrol in the KTU virtual learning environment. This does not apply to KTU students (if you are a KTU student, you may attach a blank page).
Students, who are admitted and accepted the offered place in the micro-module, will be informed by email on the steps to take in order to gain access to the KTU virtual learning environment. Students will receive an email from the teacher of the micro-module on the first day of the start of module.
Students who have dropped out from the KTU micro-module(s) in the autumn 2024 are not eligible to enrol in the KTU micro-module(s) in the spring 2025.

Description.En:
Embark on a journey through the micro-module of **Creative Intelligence**, where you'll explore the art of innovative problem-solving. This course is designed to empower you with the skills to think creatively and leverage it for problem solving in organizational level.

Micromodule is structured in such a way that you could acquire knowledge and skills about creative intelligence from two perspectives:

- Firstly, you will be able to deconstruct the concept of creative intelligence within the context of the modern world. This will broaden your knowledge and open creative thinking, allowing you to see more deeply into the complexity of various phenomena and understand the mechanisms of successful operation in the contemporary world.

- Secondly, to foster creative intelligence and enhance a modern organization's competitiveness through innovation, it's crucial to establish specific conditions via creative leadership. As a result, you will have the chance to practice the prerequisites for expressing creative intelligence within the organization.

Title.En: Explain the conception of creative intelligence

NoteLiteral.En: To achieve this goal, you will dive into the main perspectives of creative intelligence theory: discuss the relevance of creative intelligence in context, delve into the concept of creative intelligence, understand the main philosophical aspects of creativity, and decode the types of thinking important for creativity. This will broaden your knowledge and help you empower yours creative thinking.

Title.En: Practice the prerequisites for the manifestation of creative intelligence in the organisation

NoteLiteral.En: To be able to create the right conditions for the manifestation of creative intelligence and thus ensure the competitiveness of a modern organization [through innovative uncertain problem solving], certain conditions created in the organization through creative leadership are extremely important. So, to achieve this goal you will delve into the characteristics of creative leadership, specifics of creative problem solving, the essence of Design Thinking process and favourable climate for the manifestation of creativity.

MoreInformation.NoteLiteral:
In this micro-module you will try different immersive learning activities and resources: interactive E-book, scavenger hunt, discussions, problem solving task, timely readings and video lectures.

This micromodule is structured in such a way that the learners' achievements are evaluated in two ways:

- Providing course expert feedback for such activities as self-check quizzes, the discussion forum, and peer review for the scavenger hunt. However, these activities are not graded.

- Providing feedback from the course expert and evaluating the performed activities with a grade. In the first week of the course, the activity of the learners is assessed during the discussion of the topic presented by the course expert. In the second week of the course, learners perform a problem-solving task and submit a report on it. The knowledge acquired during the entire course is evaluated in the final course exam by performing a closed-question test.

[Syllabus of the micro-module](https://uais.cr.ktu.lt/ktuis/stp_report_ects.mdl_ml?p_kodas=MM00M121&p_year=2024&p_lang=EN&p_stp_id=)

The micro-module will be delivered in the KTU virtual learning environment. When a student is enrolled in KTU, s/he will be informed by email on how to gain access to the micro-module.

After the successful completion of the micro-module:

- In two weeks, a student will receive an email with the link to download the ECIU University micro-credential.
- In mid-June 2025, a student from other university than KTU will receive an email with the KTU Transcript of Records that might be presented for recognition of learning outcomes at the home university.
Empower the Art of Creative thinking for problem solving

Creative intelligence is essential to generating innovative solutions to complex problems. In a rapidly changing world, individuals and organizations need to adapt and find new ways to address challenges and manage uncertain, proactive situations. Creative thinking can lead to breakthroughs in technology, business, healthcare, and many other fields. The aim of this micromodule is to develop competencies and skills that are necessary to search for creative solutions to deal with problems by means of developing creative intelligence in an organisation.

Entry requirements:

- Student at any of the universities of the ECIU;
- B2 level of English language proficiency.

Applicants need to attach a copy of ID card / passport (document issued by the country of origin) to enrol in the KTU virtual learning environment. This does not apply to KTU students (if you are a KTU student, you may attach a blank page).  

Students, who are admitted and accepted the offered place in the micro-module, will be informed by email on the steps to take in order to gain access to the KTU virtual learning environment. Students will receive an email from the teacher of the micro-module on the first day of the start of module.  

Students who have dropped out from the KTU micro-module(s) in the autumn 2024 are not eligible to enrol in the KTU micro-module(s) in the spring 2025.
